wikipedia_page.main: Sir Roger Denis Moate (12 May 1938 – 15 April 2019) was a Conservative politician in the United Kingdom.

London Swinton Circle
response: A few city-based discussion groups with the suffix "Swinton Circle" were formed for those Conservative Party activists who had attended Conservative Party training at Swinton College. The London Swinton Circle was founded in 1965, early members included Rhodes Boyson and T. E. Utley.Knight, Christoper, The making of a Tory education policy in post-war Britain 1950-1986 The Falmer Press (1990) p81 n24 Another prominent early member was Roger Moate MP.Peter Barberis, John McHugh, Mike Tyldesley entry on London Swinton Circle  Encyclopedia of British and Irish Political Organizations Continuum International Publishing Group (2005) p185 The London Swinton Circle was the only one of the groups to continue beyond the 1970s.

Roger Denis Moate
Faversham (UK Parliament constituency)
Terence Boston, Baron Boston of Faversham
response: He was elected as Member of Parliament (MP) for Faversham at a by-election on 14 May 1964, following the death of the Labour MP Percy Wells. He was re-elected at the general election in October 1964 and again in 1966, but was defeated at the 1970 general election by the Conservative Roger Moate.
